Text:
My only real complaint is that you didn't seed your torrent until at least one other person has downloaded it 100%.

As it is right now, a number of people only have 54.1% of all the files.

Remember, the files in your torrent don't magically distribute themselves across the net. When you create a torrent, make the commitment to keep your torrent software running and seeding (uploading) for as long as you can.
sorry mike, i run azureus. it eats my system resources, so if i want to do something like open outlook in under 15min, i have to shut down azureus. i'll leave it running overnight. sorry, again.

I had that too... Azureus made my computer abnormal slow.. add 512mb ram and you will notice the difference immediately! Honoust!

greetz,
ZeNiTH_NL

No problem Banker, your torrent has already been fully seeded. I'll keep seeding for awhile myself...

I recommend uTorrent (it's not called [micro]Torrent for nothing!). I find that it uses very little system resources, yet it packs all the features you need.

And BTW, thanks for the episodes!

i'll probably change torrent programs before i buy RAM for this POS, but thanks for the advice. 
mike, does uTorrent allow you to creats torrents too. azureus makes it very easy.
YES! thank you!!! Finally a season one torrent that has seeders =.='
i recommend utorrent as well. i like it much more than azureus.
I appreciate that this is in .avi format (NOT .RAR!). Thank you for this, Please seed.
